verses.kjv: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,
verses.ct: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea during the reign of King Herod, wise men from the east arrived in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.
verses.ct: They asked, "Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star rising in the east, and we have come to worship him."

verses.kjv: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
verses.ct: When King Herod heard about this, he was deeply disturbed, and so was everyone in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.
verses.ct: He called together all the chief priests and religious scholars and asked them where the Christ was supposed to be born.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,
verses.ct: They told him, "In Bethlehem of Judaea, because the prophet wrote:

verses.kjv: And thou Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.
verses.ct: 'You, Bethlehem, in the land of Juda, are by no means the least important among the rulers of Juda, because from you will come a leader who will shepherd my people Israel.'"

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, enquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.
verses.ct: Then Herod secretly called for the wise men and found out from them the exact time the star had appeared.

verses.kjv: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.
verses.ct: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search carefully for the child. When you find him, report back to me so that I can go and worship him too."

verses.kjv: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.
verses.ct: After listening to the king, they set out on their journey. The star they had seen rising in the east went ahead of them until it stopped over the place where the child was.

verses.kjv: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.
verses.ct: When they saw the star, they were overwhelmed with joy.

verses.kjv: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.
verses.ct: They entered the house and found the child with his mother Mary. They knelt down and worshipped him. Then they opened their treasure boxes and presented him with gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

verses.kjv: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.
verses.ct: God warned them in a dream not to go back to Herod, so they returned to their own country by a different route.

verses.kjv: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.
verses.ct: After they had left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, "Get up! Take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, because Herod is going to search for the child to kill him."

verses.kjv: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:
verses.ct: So Joseph got up during the night, took the child and his mother, and left for Egypt.

verses.kjv: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.
verses.ct: They stayed there until Herod died. This fulfilled what the Lord had spoken through the prophet: "Out of Egypt I called my son."

verses.kjv: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently enquired of the wise men.
verses.ct: When Herod realized that the wise men had tricked him, he was furious. He gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem and the surrounding area who were 2 years old and younger, based on the timing he had learned from the wise men.

verses.kjv: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: This fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet Jeremy:

verses.kjv: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.
verses.ct: "A voice was heard in Rama — crying, weeping, and deep mourning. Rachel was weeping for her children and refused to be comforted, because they were gone."

verses.kjv: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
verses.ct: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt.

verses.kjv: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child’s life.
verses.ct: The angel said, "Get up! Take the child and his mother and go to the land of Israel, because those who were trying to kill the child are dead."

verses.kjv: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.
verses.ct: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and traveled to the land of Israel.

verses.kjv: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:
verses.ct: But when he learned that Archelaus was ruling over Judaea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. After being warned by God in a dream, he went to the region of Galilee instead.

verses.kjv: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.
verses.ct: He settled in a town called Nazareth. This fulfilled what the prophets had said: "He will be called a Nazarene."
